name: Ricotta and Berry Stuffed Crepes
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, milk, eggs, melted butter, sugar, vanilla extract, and salt until smooth.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and lightly coat with cooking spray.
Pour about 1/4 cup of batter into the skillet, swirling to evenly coat the bottom of the pan.
Cook until the batter sets and the edges begin to lift from the skillet, about 1-2 minutes.
Flip the crepe and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, until lightly golden.
In a medium bowl, mix ricotta cheese, honey, and lemon zest until well combined.
Spoon the ricotta mixture onto each crepe and top with mixed berries.
Fold the crepes over the filling and serve immediately.
description: Light and delicious crepes filled with a creamy ricotta cheese mixture and fresh berries. Perfect for a special breakfast or brunch.
additional_notes: You can use any variety of fresh berries such as strawberries, blueberries, raspberries, or blackberries based on your preference and availability.
